problem.p: EdX courses have many parts to them. You can find page links at the top of the site, sections and subsections in the left-hand navigation, and the Support button on the far left of your window.

choiceresponse.label: Some subsections (like this one) also have multiple pages. Where can you find the links that take you to these pages?

checkboxgroup.label: Where can you find the links that take you to these pages?
checkboxgroup.choice: Via the buttons in the "ribbon" at the top of the page. Right - The buttons in the "ribbon" can take you to a specific page. You are missing one way to get to any page you want.

Via the left-right arrows in the "ribbon" at the top of the page. Right - The arrows in the "ribbon" can take you to the next page or the previous page. You missed at least one way to get to the next page or the previous page.

Via the left-right arrows at the bottom of the page. Right - The arrows at the bottom of the page can take you to the next page or the previous page. You missed at least one way to get to the next page or the previous page.

Via links in the course that take you to a specific page. Right - Links you see in the course may take you to places inside the course, as well as places outside it. You missed at least one way to get to a specific page.
checkboxgroup.compoundhint: That's right! All of these are correct.

demandhint.hint: Look for these options and try them out!
Checkbox-style problems like this one can have any number of answers correct.
